ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to write a long paper
I thoroughly enjoyed the senior essay course structure and believe that the workshops throughout the semester were instrumental in receiving feedback and keeping on track with the deadlines!
I built upon my art history research skills in an individual capacity concerning a topic of my own choosing.
Writing my thesis gave me insight into what it's like to carry out independent research on a topic interesting to me (and not from a professor's prompt)--it was difficult but ultimately rewarding!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the course could be slightly more scaffolded-- for example, giving more of a template for how to reach out to advisors/reminders as a junior. For the annotated bibliography, 10 sources does not feel like nearly enough.
I liked the structure of this course and found that having deadlines throughout the semester kept me on track.

This course could benefit from greater departmental involvement. Projects are scored by both a student's advisor and an appointed second reader. Said second reader is not involved with the development of a student's project, though likely has familiarity with their subject area. It would be useful to seek their feedback before evaluations are determined (or at the very least for the department to connect students with additional internal resources if they expect a student to commune with experts beyond their advisor).

I thought the colloquium was nice in that it allowed us to see each other's work and get feedback from professors who have similar interests. 

The document of guidelines on Canvas was a big help, and if anything I would add a sample paper (just for format/structure things like the title page and table of contents).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: As a capstone to my experience with the department, I found the senior essay a disappointing finale. I am grateful to have developed a closer relationship with my advisor and appreciated the opportunity to commune with my upperclassman peers but think the experience is poorly structured for success. Several of my friends and their advisors were surprised to receive feedback unbecoming of or at odds with the effort they had invested in their essays. As it stands, you'll have to take this course to graduate in the major, though if these remain the conditions of graduating with an art history degree, I'd think twice about committing.
